679.quoteText:
We may revise these Terms from time to time to better reflect:

(a) changes to the law,

(b) new regulatory requirements, or

(c) improvements or enhancements made to our Services.

If an update affects your use of the Services or your legal rights as a user of our Services, we’ll notify you prior to the update's effective date by sending an email to the email address associated with your account or via an in-product notification. These updated terms will be effective no less than 30 days from when we notify you.

If you don’t agree to the updates we make, please cancel your account before they become effective.
679.title: When the service wants to change its terms, users are notified a month or more in advance

tosdr.case: When the service wants to make a material change to its terms, users are notified at least 30 days in advance
tosdr.tldr: They can change the terms of service any time they see fit, but they will notify the user. Your use of the service supposedly constitutes acceptance of the changes in the terms.

762.quoteText:
We may revise this Privacy Policy from time to time, and will post the most current version on our website.
If a revision meaningfully reduces your rights, we will notify you.
762.title: Dropbox will notify of changes on the terms

tosdr.case: The service may change its terms at any time, but the user will receive notification of the changes.
tosdr.tldr: Dropbox will notify of changes on the terms

1587.quoteText: Refunds are only issued if required by law.
1587.title: no refund policy

tosdr.case: The service has a no refund policy

1602.quoteText: These Terms don’t give us any rights to Your Stuff except for the limited rights that enable us to offer the Services.
1602.title: You maintain ownership of your data

tosdr.case: You maintain ownership of your data
tosdr.tldr: "These Terms don't give us any rights to Your Stuff except for the limited rights that enable us to offer the Services."

6887.quoteText:
We collect and use the personal data described above in order to provide you with the Services in a reliable and secure manner.
We also collect and use personal data for our legitimate business needs.
To the extent we process your personal data for other purposes, we ask for your consent in advance or require that our partners obtain such consent.
For more information on the lawful bases for processing your data, please see our FAQ.
</p
6887.title: The service provides information about how they intend to use your personal data

tosdr.case: The service provides information about how they intend to use your personal data

6945.quoteText: We may share information as discussed below, but we won’t sell it to advertisers or other third parties.
6945.title: This service does not sell your personal data

tosdr.case: This service does not sell your personal data

7770.quoteText:
Where

Around the world. To provide you with the Services, we may store, process, and transmit data in the United States and locations around the world—including those outside your country
7770.title: Your data may be processed and stored anywhere in the world

tosdr.case: Your data may be processed and stored anywhere in the world

7771.quoteText: p> If we’re involved in a reorganization, merger, acquisition, or sale of our assets, your data may be transferred as part of that deal
7771.title: The service can sell or otherwise transfer your personal data as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction.

tosdr.case: The service can sell or otherwise transfer your personal data as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction.

11244.quoteText:
Trusted third parties include:

  • Dropbox, Inc.
  • Amazon Web Services, Inc.
  • Teleperformance A.E.
  • Salesforce.com, LLC
  • Serenova, LLC (formerly LiveOps Cloud Platform, LLC)
  • Google LLC
  • Zendesk, Inc.
  • Oracle America, Inc.
11244.title: Many third parties are involved in operating the service

tosdr.case: Many third parties are involved in operating the service

11245.quoteText: We may also use third-party service providers that set cookies and similar technologies to promote Dropbox services.
11245.title: Tracking via third-party cookies for other purposes without your consent.

tosdr.case: Tracking via third-party cookies for other purposes without your consent.

11689.title: The service is provided 'as is' and to be used at the users' sole risk

tosdr.case: The service is provided 'as is' and to be used at the users' sole risk

11690.quoteText: You can access, amend, download, and delete your personal information by logging into your Dropbox account and going to your account settings page.
11690.title: You can request access and deletion of personal data

tosdr.case: You can request access and deletion of personal data

11691.quoteText: We use technologies like cookies and pixel tags to provide, improve, protect, and promote our Services.
11691.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

11692.quoteText: If our systems receive a DNT:1 signal from your browser, we’ll respond to that signal as outlined here
11692.title: This service respects your browser's Do Not Track (DNT) headers

tosdr.case: This service respects your browser's Do Not Track (DNT) headers

11699.quoteText: You can set your browser to not accept cookies, but this may limit your ability to use the Services.
11699.title: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service

tosdr.case: Blocking first party cookies may limit your ability to use the service
